In the late 90's they brought us the most
advanced search engine on the web.

8.text:
A year later, they revolutionised the way
we use maps...

12.text:
Google is making it its mission to simplify
every aspect of our lives.

17.text:
And now they're setting their sights on another
target - our cities.

21.text:
Google boss Larry Page has teamed up with
Dan Doctoroff, the former Deputy Mayor of

26.text: New York, to launch Sidewalk Labs.

30.text:
Posting on his Google Plus profile, Page said
Sidewalk would develop 'urban technologies'

35.text:
to address issues like the cost of living,
efficient transportation and energy usage.

41.text:
Google have put an undisclosed amount of money
into the start-up, an amount Larry Page described

48.text:
What modest means for a company which turned
over 66 BILLION dollars last year is not clear....

55.text: So what exactly might they do?

57.text:
Well THAT's not entirely clear either...but
Google does already have some urban projects

64.text:
Google first started testing driverless cars
over 6 years ago... This is what they look

71.text:
And the company hopes its Google Glass product
will change the way we work.

75.text:
It all sounds pretty great if you like simple,
efficient products... but are there any downsides to living

84.text:
Some people certainly think so and chief among
their concerns is privacy.

91.text:
In Britain, Google is this month facing a
lawsuit by more than 2,000 Apple customers

96.text:
who claim the company bypassed safeguards
built into their phones web browsers to track

102.text:
their internet usage and send them targeted
advertising.

108.text:
taking a swipe at the company, hinting that

115.text:
Of course, the company still has some other
issues to iron out before we end up being

119.text: chauffeured around by a search engine.

121.text:
Newly released information shows that Google's test

129.text: Something for Sidewalk Labs to work on perhaps!
